page.title: 04BERE FERRERS CHURCH
page.content: The Church of St.Andrews is in a very bad state and was in danger of being knocked down. It is being restored very drastically at this moment.Such a very beautiful, 13th Century Church,with a Chancel window of 14th Century stained glass and a lovely Norman font of Hurdwick stone, (one of only ten in the country)is a magnificent possession for a small village.No wonder every effort has been made by a village united in its aim to preserve it's heritage. So the parishioners must bear the inconvenience of a cement and sand strewn Churchyard,builders with their plastic sheets and scaffolding and,the greatest deprivation of all:they cannot use their own Church for services but have to be accommodated in the Methodist Chapel .
